mods.abstract: Temple of Isis at Philae (Ptolemaic Period); ruined open papyrus colonnade and court of temple, wall inscribed with deities and hieroglyphs (foreground); pylon inscribed with deities (background); "Frith E No 23 1857" in black at bottom right; "VIEW ON PHILAE" in black at below center of print. (Original number unknown, print given 1997.5.5 based on information in accession record, M.K., M.R.J., 1/31/2013)

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
